citation.article-title: Taxonomic heterogeneity within the Planctomycetales as derived by DNA-DNA hybridization, description of Rhodopirellula baltica gen. nov., sp. nov., transfer of Pirellula marina to the genus Blastopirellula gen. nov. as Blastopirellula marina comb. nov. and emended description of the genus Pirellula.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Rhodopirellula (Rho.do.pi.rel′lu.la. Gr. neut. n. rhodon a rose; N.L. fem. n. Pirellula name of a bacterial genus; N.L. fem. n. Rhodopirellula a red Pirellula).
Cells are ovoid, ellipsoidal or pear-shaped, occurring singly or in rosettes by attachment at the smaller cell pole.
Buds are formed at the broader cell pole.
Buds may have a single flagellum inserted subpolarly at the proximal pole.
Crateriform structures and fimbriae are found in the upper cell region.
Colonies are pink to red in colour.
The proteinaceous cell wall lacks peptidoglycan.
The major polyamines are putrescine, cadaverine and sym-homospermidine.
The major fatty acids are 16 : 1Δ9, 16 : 0, 17 : 1Δ9, 17 : 0, 18 : 1Δ9, 18 : 1Δ11 and 18 : 0.
The major phospholipids are phosphatidylcholine and phosphatidylglycerol.
Additional, unidentified polar lipids are also present.
This genus is a member of the phylum Planctomycetes, order Planctomycetales, family Planctomycetaceae, as currently defined primarily on the basis of 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis.
The type species is Rhodopirellula baltica.
